get.summary:
tapcli: `universe federation list`
ListFederationServers lists the set of servers that make up the federation
of the local Universe server. This servers are used to push out new proofs,
and also periodically call sync new proofs from the remote server.

delete.summary:
tapcli: `universe federation del`
DeleteFederationServer removes a server from the federation of the local
Universe server.

post.summary:
tapcli: `universe federation add`
AddFederationServer adds a new server to the federation of the local
Universe server. Once a server is added, this call can also optionally be
used to trigger a sync of the remote server.

get.summary:
tapcli: `universe info`
Info returns a set of information about the current state of the Universe.

tapcli: `universe keys`
AssetLeafKeys queries for the set of Universe keys associated with a given
asset_id or group_key. Each key takes the form: (outpoint, script_key),
where outpoint is an outpoint in the Bitcoin blockcahin that anchors a
valid Taproot Asset commitment, and script_key is the script_key of
the asset within the Taproot Asset commitment for the given asset_id or
group_key.

parameters.name: asset_id_str
parameters.description: The 32-byte asset ID encoded as a hex string (use this for REST).

parameters.name: asset_id
parameters.description: The 32-byte asset ID specified as raw bytes (gRPC only).

parameters.name: group_key
parameters.description: The 32-byte asset group key specified as raw bytes (gRPC only).

parameters.name: group_key_str
parameters.description:
The 32-byte asset group key encoded as hex string (use this for
REST).

get.summary:
tapcli: `universe leaves`
AssetLeaves queries for the set of asset leaves (the values in the Universe
MS-SMT tree) for a given asset_id or group_key. These represents either
asset issuance events (they have a genesis witness) or asset transfers that
took place on chain. The leaves contain a normal Taproot Asset proof, as
well as details for the asset.

get.summary:
tapcli: `universe proofs query`
QueryProof attempts to query for an issuance or transfer proof for a given
asset based on its UniverseKey. A UniverseKey is composed of the Universe
ID (asset_id/group_key) and also a leaf key (outpoint || script_key). If
found, then the issuance proof is returned that includes an inclusion proof
to the known Universe root, as well as a Taproot Asset state transition or
issuance proof for the said asset.

parameters.name: id.asset_id_str
parameters.description: The 32-byte asset ID encoded as a hex string (use this for REST).

parameters.name: leaf_key.op.hash_str
parameters.description: The output as a hex encoded (and reversed!) string.

parameters.name: leaf_key.op.index
parameters.description: The index of the output.

parameters.name: id.asset_id
parameters.description: The 32-byte asset ID specified as raw bytes (gRPC only).

parameters.name: id.group_key
parameters.description: The 32-byte asset group key specified as raw bytes (gRPC only).

parameters.name: id.group_key_str
parameters.description:
The 32-byte asset group key encoded as hex string (use this for
REST).

post.summary:
tapcli: `universe proofs insert`
InsertProof attempts to insert a new issuance or transfer proof into the
Universe tree specified by the UniverseKey. If valid, then the proof is
inserted into the database, with a new Universe root returned for the
updated asset_id/group_key.

parameters.name: key.id.asset_id_str
parameters.description: The 32-byte asset ID encoded as a hex string (use this for REST).

parameters.name: key.leaf_key.op.hash_str
parameters.description: The output as a hex encoded (and reversed!) string.

parameters.name: key.leaf_key.op.index
parameters.description: The index of the output.

tapcli: `universe roots`
AssetRoots queries for the known Universe roots associated with each known
asset. These roots represent the supply/audit state for each known asset.

tapcli: `universe roots`
QueryAssetRoots attempts to locate the current Universe root for a specific
asset. This asset can be identified by its asset ID or group key.

get.summary:
tapcli: `universe stats`
UniverseStats returns a set of aggregate statistics for the current state
of the Universe. Stats returned include: total number of syncs, total
number of proofs, and total number of known assets.

tapcli `universe stats assets`
QueryAssetStats returns a set of statistics for a given set of assets.
Stats can be queried for all assets, or based on the: asset ID, name, or
asset type. Pagination is supported via the offset and limit params.
Results can also be sorted based on any of the main query params.

tapcli `universe stats events`
QueryEvents returns the number of sync and proof events for a given time
period, grouped by day.

post.summary:
tapcli: `universe sync`
SyncUniverse takes host information for a remote Universe server, then
attempts to synchronize either only the set of specified asset_ids, or all
assets if none are specified. The sync process will attempt to query for
the latest known root for each asset, performing tree based reconciliation
to arrive at a new shared root.

anchor_tx.description:
The transaction that anchors the Taproot Asset commitment where the asset
 resides.

anchor_txid.description: The txid of the above transaction.

anchor_block_hash.description: The block hash the contains the anchor transaction above.

anchor_outpoint.description: The outpoint (txid:vout) that stores the Taproot Asset commitment.

internal_key.description: The raw internal key that was used to create the anchor Taproot output key.

merkle_root.description:
The Taproot merkle root hash of the anchor output the asset was committed
to. If there is no Tapscript sibling, this is equal to the Taproot Asset
root commitment hash.

tapscript_sibling.description:
The serialized preimage of a Tapscript sibling, if there was one. If this
is empty, then the merkle_root hash is equal to the Taproot root hash of the
anchor output.

block_height.description: The height of the block which contains the anchor transaction.

version.description: The version of the Taproot Asset.

asset_genesis.description: The base genesis information of an asset. This information never changes.

amount.description: The total amount of the asset stored in this Taproot Asset UTXO.

lock_time.description: An optional locktime, as with Bitcoin transactions.

relative_lock_time.description: An optional relative lock time, same as Bitcoin transactions.

script_version.description: The version of the script, only version 0 is defined at present.

script_key.description: The script key of the asset, which can be spent under Taproot semantics.

script_key_is_local.description:
Indicates whether the script key is known to the wallet of the lnd node
connected to the Taproot Asset daemon.

asset_group.description: The information related to the key group of an asset (if it exists).

chain_anchor.description: Describes where in the chain the asset is currently anchored.

is_spent.description: Indicates whether the asset has been spent.

raw_group_key.description: The raw group key which is a normal public key.

tweaked_group_key.description:
The tweaked group key, which is derived based on the genesis point and also
asset type.

asset_id_sig.description: A signature over the genesis point using the above key.

taprpcAssetType.description:
- NORMAL: Indicates that an asset is capable of being split/merged, with each of the
units being fungible, even across a key asset ID boundary (assuming the
key group is the same).
 - COLLECTIBLE: Indicates that an asset is a collectible, meaning that each of the other
items under the same key group are not fully fungible with each other.
Collectibles also cannot be split or merged.

genesis_point.description: The first outpoint of the transaction that created the asset (txid:vout).

meta_hash.description: The hash of the meta data for this genesis asset.

asset_id.description: The asset ID that uniquely identifies the asset.

output_index.description:
The index of the output that carries the unique Taproot Asset commitment in
the genesis transaction.

version.description: The version of the Taproot Asset commitment that created this asset.

asset.description: The asset included in the leaf.

issuance_proof.description:
The asset issuance proof, which proves that the asset specified above
was issued properly.

asset_keys.description: The set of asset leaf keys for the given asset ID or group key.

leaves.description: The set of asset leaves for the given asset ID or group key.

key.description: The ID of the asset to insert the proof for.

asset_leaf.description: The asset leaf to insert into the Universe tree.

req.description: The request original request for the issuance proof.

universe_root.description: The Universe root that includes this asset leaf.

universe_inclusion_proof.description:
An inclusion proof for the asset leaf included below. The value is that
issuance proof itself, with a sum value of the amount of the asset.

asset_leaf.description: The asset leaf itself, which includes the asset and the issuance proof.

multiverse_root.description:
MultiverseRoot is the root of the multiverse tree that includes this
asset leaf.

multiverse_inclusion_proof.description:
MultiverseInclusionProof is the inclusion proof for the asset leaf in the
multiverse.

universe_roots.description:
A map of the set of known universe roots for each asset. The key in the
map is the 32-byte asset_id or group key hash.

date.description: The date the events occurred on, formatted as YYYY-MM-DD.

asset_id.description: The 32-byte asset ID specified as raw bytes (gRPC only).

asset_id_str.description: The 32-byte asset ID encoded as a hex string (use this for REST).

group_key.description: The 32-byte asset group key specified as raw bytes (gRPC only).

group_key_str.description:
The 32-byte asset group key encoded as hex string (use this for
REST).

runtime_id.description:
A pseudo-random runtime ID for the current instance of the Universe
server, changes with each restart. Mainly used to identify identical
servers when they are exposed under different hostnames/ports.

num_assets.description: The number of assets known to this Universe server.

root_hash.description: The MS-SMT root hash for the branch node.

root_sum.description:
The root sum of the branch node. This is hashed to create the root_hash
along with the left and right siblings. This value represents the total
known supply of the asset.

hash_str.description: The output as a hex encoded (and reversed!) string.

asset_root.description: The asset root for the given asset ID or group key.

sync_mode.description: The sync mode. This determines what type of proofs are synced.

sync_targets.description:
The set of assets to sync. If none are specified, then all assets are
synced.

synced_universes.description: The set of synced asset Universes.

old_asset_root.description: The old Universe root for the synced asset.

new_asset_root.description: The new Universe root for the synced asset.

new_asset_leaves.description: The set of new asset leaves that were synced.

id.description: The ID of the asset to query for.

leaf_key.description: The asset key to query for.

mssmt_root.description:
The merkle sum sparse merkle tree root associated with the above
universe ID.

universerpcUniverseSyncMode.description:
- SYNC_ISSUANCE_ONLY: A sync node that indicates that only new asset creation (minting) proofs
should be synced.
 - SYNC_FULL: A syncing mode that indicates that all asset proofs should be synced.
This includes normal transfers as well.
